passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be reprinted, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.
APAC Energy Transition (Alan Hon / Hannah L Lee)

The road to a clean energy future is long (and uncertain). While the energy transition remains an overarching theme, history has shown that renewable energy build- out at scale does not necessarily translate into returns at all points of the value chain. Industry cycles, technological advancement, and geopolitics all come into play. In this report, we give10 answers to questions relating to the transition on three main topics: 1) Which transition value chains are in supply tightness or emerging as important ones? 2) Where are geopolitical risks less well understood? 3) Which transition technologies will be the next game changers? JPM- covered stocks that emerge as our top picks include: Bannerman Energy (BMN), CATL- A, Hyundai Electric, Hyosung Heavy, ILU, LG Chem, LG Energy Solution, Orient Cables, Sieyuan and Tenaga.
Luxshare - A (002475. SZ, OW - Rmb46.10), China (Billy Feng)
Rising contribution from strong auto/communication; better- than- expected consolidation; reiterate OW

During the earnings call, management addressed: 1) strong revenue growth in auto and communication segments in 1H25, attributable to positive portfolio expansion, which is expected to boost growth continuously; 2) sustainable and resilient growth outlook, even in a complex macro situation, backed by its diversified business, globalized capacity, high- quality delivery and its superior capability of intelligent manufacture, and, 3) better- than- expected consolidation of newly acquired business (including Leoni and ODM business, both settled in July). We expect a better revenue mix (rising contribution from high- margin auto and communication segments) and project a 26% earnings CAGR in 2024- 27. We reiterate OW on Luxshare with an extended Jun- 26 PT of Rmb63.
Huaqin Technology - A (603296. SS, OW - Rmb96.06), China (Cherry Liu / Billy Feng) Strong growth across segments in 1H25; optimistic on AI momentum and growth outlook; reiterate OW

Key takeaways from Huaqin's earnings call include: 1) strong earnings growth of 46% yoy in 1H25 was driven by accelerating AI server delivery and strong momentum in smartphone/PC/wearable areas; 2) GPM dropped sequentially in 2Q25, due to product mix change, but is expected to recover with a better mix; 3) management expects >Rmb40bn datacenter revenue in 2025 and further growth ahead, given continuous demand from CSPs and Huaqin's full- stack portfolio with share- gain potential; and 4) an unchanged target

of a \(\sim 17\%\) revenue CAGR and stronger earnings growth with margin expansion in 2024- 30. We consider Huaqin's growth outlook to be intact, supported by strong momentum across its diversified layout; reiterate OW with a Jun- 26 PT of Rmb115.
Innovent Biologics (1801) (1801. HK, OW - HK\$90.65), China (Yang Huang)
Raise PT post strong 1H25; reiterate as top pick in China biopharma

While product sales were already pre- announced, Innovent's 1H25 GPM and opex both came in better than our expectations. We are impressed by the strong momentum in the company's commercialized products and the progress of its pipeline assets. As part of its globalization initiative, Innovent is actively launching global trials for its oncology and other assets while exploring strategic BD (business development) opportunities. Its early pipeline assets are progressing smoothly, demonstrating solid potential to drive the next phase of growth. Overall, we view Innovent as one of the most diversified and innovative biopharma companies in China. We reiterate it as our top pick in China biopharma, raise our price target, and maintain an OW rating.
Li Auto - H & ADR, China (Nick Lai)

Li Auto's (Li) 2Q25 results came in about \(17\%\) below JPME (GAAP earnings), dragged by higher- than- expected opex while vehicle GPM was in line. Mgmt highlighted the company's LT strategies, including product pipeline, autonomous driving roadmap, overseas ambitions and financial outlook. Overall, we welcome the company's initiatives, though our reservations lie in rising competition, in particular in the mid- to high- end BEV SUVs that are Li's focus (i8 and coming i6 in Sept). The company's 3Q25 volume guidance (16- 21% below our previous estimate) suggests potential downside to consensus volume/earnings projections in the rest of the year and 2026. The stock is down \(2\%\) YTD (MSCI China Autos \(+30\%\) ). We lower our 2025/26 estimates by \(42\% /14\%\) and stay Neutral.
Zhongsheng Group Holdings (0881) (0881. HK, OW - HK\$15.25), China (Nick Lai)

We think 1H25 marks the trough of profitability. Zhongsheng (ZS)'s 1H25 earnings were \(\sim 20\%\) shy of JPME, dragged by record low margins in new car sales as a result of 1) fierce price competition in auto market and 2) limited rebate from OEMs, which we expect to increase meaningfully in 2H25. We notice industry- wide price discounts hit record highs by June - right before the Chinese government intervened and launched its anti- involution campaign to curb irrational pricing behavior among OEMs. We upgraded ZS to OW on July 28 (here) on long- term expectations that ZS will see structural profitability improvement from anti- involution efforts in the next 1- 2 years. This view remains intact.
Asia ex- Japan Equity Strategy, Global (Rajiv Batra / Mixo Das / Wendy Liu / Khoi Vu, CFA) Liquidity floats all, but manage risks in crowded spaces

Our aggregate measure of investor positioning in Asia now sits around the 85th %ile (having gone as high as \(97^{\text{th}}\) ) in July - Figure 1). While this would normally be considered a significant headwind, the global policy easing and China liquidity surge currently underway is providing a strong counter force. In this context, we believe the equity bull market will remain intact and any correction/consolidation will present a buying opportunity. However, it is important to manage risks where positioning is particularly crowded. Looking across LO, HF and Quant investors, we note the highest crowding in Taiwan Tech/Semis and Indo Financials, followed by China Growth stocks (semis, consumer and biotech). Alongside this, ongoing support from monetary policy should eventually warrant a widening of the leadership and outperformance of Cyclicals. We are upgrading the Materials sector to OW in the AxJ region following our recent allocation changes in India (see report). Within the AxJ region, our pecking order is Korea > India > China > Taiwan > ASEAN. Our key OWs are: China Tech, Internet, Healthcare, Materials, select Financial/Industrials; India
Financials, Consumer ex Auto, Materials, Real Estate, Hospitals, select power/defense; Korea Financials, Tech, Holdco; TSMC in Taiwan; and AN Financials, Real Estate, Utilities, Healthcare, IT.
